snippet: Clashes between Syrian insurgents and loyalist troops in Damascus raged for a second day on Thursday and spread to the suburbs and other areas, activist groups reported.
abstract: Clashes between Syrian insurgents and loyalist troops in Damascus rage for second day and spread to suburbs and other areas; expanded violence, described as some of worst fighting to afflict Damascus in months, offers further indication that hopes for diplomatic resolution to nearly two-year-old conflict has all but evaporated.

byline.original: By HANIA MOURTADA and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Hania Mourtada reported from Beirut, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Reporting was contributed by an employee of The New York Times from Damascus, Syria; Hwaida Saad from Beirut; Hala Droubi from Dubai, United Arab Emirates; and Alan Cowell from Paris.

lead_paragraph: Clashes between Syrian insurgents and loyalist troops in Damascus raged for a second day on Thursday and spread to the suburbs and other areas, activist groups reported.

headline.main: Fight Expands in Damascus as Diplomatic Hopes Sink
headline.print_headline: Fight Expands in Damascus as Diplomatic Hopes Sink
